Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2014 05:40PM applepop wrote: Mikishelley- you are beautiful. I am not even brave enough to shave my hair yet. My five year old is having a time with the thought of me being bald. He told me to please go get a wig. I have bad acne since chemo. That makes the whole bald thing seem worse to me. Is anyone else breaking out?
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in April 2014 Kazzy115 Sunshine36

Posts.Content: Jul 24, 2014 02:20PM - edited Jul 24, 2014 02:36PM by applepop Hi everyone. I haven't posted much and it has been a while since I have posted, but I have read every single post. Thanks to everyone who has taken the time to post about their experiences. I am sure your posts have helped many.  Congratulations to those who have finished or will finish chemo soon. My last chemo (#6 TCHP) is tomorrow. This has been one heck of a ride. I am extremely nervous about tomorrows treatment. I am already exhausted and do not look forward to the dark days that lie ahead. At least I know the dark doesn't last forever. Praying for you all and wishing you all the brightest of futures.

Posts.Content: May 2, 2014 06:59AM applepop wrote: Hello ladies. I am usually in the sun quite a bit, but have tried to avoid it lately. I love being outside though. I go stir crazy staying in side.
